data.title: Fix RA Spy attack sequence
data.body: Fixes #12894.

data.title: Refactor Transform to make use of child activities
data.body:
This is a follow-up to @pchote's comment in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/12558#issuecomment-284102670.

The weird bug mentioned by @abcdefg30 in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/12886#issuecomment-284155593 is not fixed by this. That seems to a bug in `Mobile`, I think.

data.title: Implement original hunter-seeker targeting logic.

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body: This is distinct from #6478, which is something that we probably want to consider as a future gameplay improvement after we have a properly working game.

data.title: Turreted units in tunnels will try to attack from underground.

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body: I accounted for this for `AttackFrontal` (for the Devil's tongue), but didn't think about other Attack* units inside tunnels.  The [CanInteractWithGroundLayer](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Activities/Attack.cs#L105) check needs to be added to the other attack types.

data.title: Add AI build cap for silos

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body: The AI will currently fill its base with endless silos.  Related to #12915.

data.title: Balance harvesting / economy to match the original game

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body: Right now it is trivially easy to bring in more income than you can spend â€“ fix this by adjusting our tib value, harvest speed / capacity / etc to match the original game.

data.title: Subterranean / Jumpjet actors should return to the ground layer when idle

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.title: Enemy subterranean units should not be selectable while submerged.

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
`Mobile` should implement `IVisibilityModifier` so that they remain hidden unless explicitly detected with a sensor.

This includes tunnels too.

data.title: Implement local sensor trait

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
For the mobile sensor array unit.

This will want to be done with a trait pair for the sensor and units to be detected.  The trait on the sensed unit should use an `IEffectAboveShroud` (like the `GPSDot`) to render unconditionally above the terrain and shroud.  The trait can use conditions to unconditionally render while underground (even if it isn't under fog).

As an improvement over the original game, I would like to see this use our GPSDot icons instead of just rendering the healthbars.

data.title: LAT-aware buildable concrete

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body: This will need to combine aspects of `BuildableTerrainLayer` and `D2kResourceLayer`.

data.title: Fix spurious warnings when the support mods dir doesn't exist.
data.body:
Fixes #12823.
Fixes #12897.

data.title: Remove oramod and orarep file type handlers from Windows and Linux.
data.body:
This takes us another small step towards supporting parallel engine / self-contained thirdparty mod installs.

It is a shame to remove direct orarep launching, but as discussed earlier I don't see a feasible way for us to maintain support for this when we have multiple parallel engine installs.  This is one of the only downsides of #12554, and it is far outweighed by all the benefits that brings.

Closes #13082.

data.title: Polish Morbid Aimless Poseidon
data.body:
While reviewing the TD map pool overhaul, I noticed that on `Morbid Aimless Poseidon`. a lot of the cliffs, in particular "north-facing" ones, only reptitively used a single variant. In some cases the variant that should only be used for the "left ending" of a cliff, on top of that. I fixed the latter and added variation to the former cases.

It would be too much hassle to screenshot all changes, so I'm showing just one example.
Before:
![poseidon-before](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2857877/23589030/a1d3203c-01c6-11e7-9e79-f0ad1e6201a1.png)

After:
![poseidon-after](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2857877/23589031/ab11207c-01c6-11e7-8d38-a6515a9bd069.png)

Might be a candidate for stable branch.

data.title: Source tarballs and zips don't have the correct version set
data.body: The binary versions for releases have correct versions in the game. But if you compile from source, for example, for [latest playtest](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/archive/playtest-20170304.tar.gz), it will say "{DEV_VERSION}" instead of "playtest-20170304".

data.title: Allow specific mods to be launched from MD/XS >= 6.1 gui.
data.body:
This is the first of a couple of tweaks to prepare for the removal of the ingame mod chooser.  The mod to launch can be selected from the VS/MD GUI as shown (we can't get rid of the base OpenRA.Game configuration, so that will now always launch RA).

![screen shot 2017-03-05 at 12 25 06](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/23587186/d9894434-019e-11e7-9290-780dff5ddd02.png)

![screen shot 2017-03-05 at 12 24 26](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/23587185/d9884ba6-019e-11e7-9c80-1670ad61b4be.png)

data.title: Create and add mirrored bridge tiles in the Map Editor.
data.body:
It might not be the easiest thing to do considering shadow work and making it fit other tiles but having a bridge option going bottom-right to top-left in addition to the default would bring about new options for making good naval maps.

Default:
![bridge](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/23586268/1fff7d8c-0192-11e7-8c35-451ada78057a.jpg)

data.title: TD Missing units.
data.body:
#12818 OP did a fantastic job in cleaning up the assets in the missions. :D Very well done sir!

But it has also takened away a few things from the original that you could build. (Im still working on this list. Im sick as a dog at the time of writing this)

GDI mission 2:

When you capture the Nod MCV and build a barracks you can build engineers from the Nod barracks. The refinery is also missing from the Nod MCV. 

GDI Mission 3:

Capturing the Nod MCV/Barracks you can build rocket infantry.

GDI Mission 5a:

This is a small one but I can ignore it. Nod light tank is buildable without a com center.

GDI Mission 5b:

Nod has the option to build chem troopers but requires the temple. (Which at this stage of the mission is not possible.)

Nod Mission 7c: In Orca theft capturing the helipad you are unable to build extra Orcas.

Nod Mission 8a: Medium tanks do not require com center.

Still working on list as much as I can. I know its knit picking for just small details and reaperrr who worked on the changes did an awesome job.

data.title: Muzzle offsets for the AA gun & Turret disrupted by attacks.
data.body:
If you build a Turret or an AA gun next to some enemies, the enemy's attack creates an issue where the muzzle offsets display incorrectly.

Affects RA & TD, 20161019 & 20170304.
![openra-2017-03-03t160033481z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22008761/23582879/dcd6f2b8-0102-11e7-8673-1879d3913934.png)

data.title: Traits-playtest page threw a Travis error.
data.body:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits-%28playtest%29

I would fix that, but the cause should be figured out beforehand.

data.title: Remove workarounds from allies05a
data.body: Follow-up of #12683. Also fixes the Colt sometimes shooting even after Tanya was released (easy noticeable on higher game speeds).

The latest playtest 20170304 fails to detect the action of capturing the ore refinery and tech center.

data.title: The Spy's attack animation isn't working. [playtest-20170304]
data.body: They no longer fire their pistol, they just stand idle when shooting.

data.title: crash log
data.body:
Taking a guess this is where to report a crash, from the stack looks some sort of sequence missing for one of the units I guess, though its a map I've not tried before so maybe something specific to that.. 

data.title: Fix makefile install rule.
Add the current mod to the external mods database on launch.
